elements.text:
You just slipped while on a walk outside. Your mind begins to start worrying that this is your symptoms beginning to manifest and wonder if your whole life has just changed in an instant.

Here are some behaviors that someone might do at that moment or in the future:

texts: I call my doctor's office to resolve the ambiguity.
I take some deep breaths to calm myself down.
I want to grab the nearest ride home and never risk being seen symptomatic in public, but I decide to finish my walk as a way to calm my nerves.
It feels so easy to give into the anxiety, but I steady myself and count to ten in my head to calm myself down.
I start sprialing and think of what symptom will develop next.
